pros: Work with your schedule and very relaxed
cons: Small town if you are looking for employment in a greater area

job_title: Assistant Director, Career Services in Alamosa, CO
pros: the students were amazing! The staff truly cared about students
cons: They were going through alot of staffing changes at the time, which made consistency in programming and suppoert difficult

pros: Networking, housing and dining, campus partners
cons: Week on call, limited staffing

job_title: Strength and Conditioning Coach in Alamosa, CO
pros: Provided with a great deal of independence throughout the experience and expected to learn things from both successes and mistakes.
cons: The ability to fund the strength and conditioning program is very limited, hence the limited amount of compensation to work ratio.

job_title: Director of Facilities Services in Alamosa, CO
pros:
Leadership is always willing to listen with an open mind.
There is a cooperative spirit between the individual departments.
cons: Lack of funding for deferred maintenance needs

job_title: Manager of Support Services in Alamosa, CO
pros: This small university the values diversity and inclusivity. Because we are small we are more nimble. Good people who care.
cons: Poor funding from the state of Colorado. Lots of smaller offices and people doing lots of different tasks.

pros: Small Valley University that supports the SLV
cons: Very unorganized and lack of culture

pros: Location is great for lifestyle.
cons: Location is windy in the Spring

pros: Small Community, Friendly, Welcoming, Tight-Knit, Kind
cons: Rural, Weather, Communication, Limited Stores

review_title: Incredible students and close knit community
pros:
- Love the students- they are driven, resourceful and resilient. 
- Many dedicated staff who truly care about student learning and success
- Small campus allows you to get to know students and staff on an individual level
- Flexibility in role- pitching and trying out new ideas was encouraged by my direct supervisor
- Ability to support success of underserved students
cons:
- Size of campus and town makes it difficult to move up or find new positions
- In a period of adjustment- mismanagement and poor fiscal decisions made by previous leadership. Steps taken to right size campus have lead to some tension amongst faculty and staff
- inconsistency in leadership- positive or negative experience is highly dependent upon department.

pros: Management allowed for plenty of freedom for employees to handle their own responsibilities which was a great opportunity for me as a young professional.
cons: Alamosa can be a struggle at times, very difficult to travel to and from.  Lower salary due to a lower cost of living in the area.

job_title: Box Office Manager in Alamosa, CO
pros: You get to work within some area around campus that pertains to your degree plan and the scheduling all works around your classes instead of you working your schedules around your classes.
cons: Sometimes you feel like you never really end up leaving campus.

job_title: Research Lab Supervisor in Alamosa, CO
pros: Excellent archaeological experience. The Goddards provide a working environment that facilitate both science and learning.
cons: Necessarily isolated work. You got to go to  where the work is and that's often in the middle of nowhere.

pros: Friendly people and someone always willing to help. Very community oriented.
cons: Each department of study can be different with great environments or not so great environments that lack leadership.

review_title: Good place to work if you are currently going to school
pros: The GTLC was great and as long as students showed up you could do a lot of good.
cons: The Adams State University payroll system is strange for sure.

pros: Personable, Small town, Educated Professionals
cons: Not much personable growth, Not well suited for people who do not like small towns

pros: Great place to develop an understanding of how larger organizations work if you have no previous experience in the field.
cons: Very little room for growth of any kind.

pros: Great people really lenient school
